page.title: 12BREDON HILL, LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The villages of Elmley Castle and Little Comberton stand on the original Saxon sites.The church ruins became the foundations for the Norman churches.Following the feudal wars of 1135-1153 the castle at Elmley grew in importance.The deer park was enclosed and the village prospered.By 1298 the castle had fallen into disrepair and finally became a quarry;the stone used locally for churches,houses,walls and bridges.The Middle Ages saw development of sheep farming and corn growing.In 1575 Queen Elizabeth I visited Elmley Castle.By the mid eighteenth century there were farm orchards for the consumption of fresh fruit and cider production,market gardening had increased.The orchards have now disappeared with an increase in corn production.
